intro: Acer italum subsp. variabile, commonly known as the variable maple, is a deciduous tree native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its variable leaf shape, which can range from ovate to elliptic, and its distinctive red or orange autumn foliage. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, appearing in early spring before the leaves emerge. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
